text: hi my name is Randy Moore and I am the
writer and director of escape from
tomorrow so this is a scene about a
quarter of the way through the film
where Jim and his son are following
these two French girls around the park
he found out earlier that he lost his
job and he's sort of having a mental
breakdown at this point he's been
enchanted by these two girls for their
free-spirited nature you remember when
you were afraid of the teacups same
thing this is obviously a green screen
shot I wish I played some Space Mountain
in Anaheim and then we shot all this
stuff indoors at occidental Studios in
LA no this is Orlando that's real now
we're back in green screen land this
shot I wanted to be even more wonky than
it was but we used a post facility in
Korea that tried to make it look as nice
as they could thought should have had
more of a 50s kind of processed shot
feel to it that's Roy Abramson the actor
not being a good father taking his son
on a ride that he shouldn't have and now
we're back to Elena Schubert and Kaitlyn
Rodriguez who played Emily and Sarah who
have been waiting for hours while dad
was around
you know chasing these French girls
around the park so this was a location
that we wanted to use primarily because
you could see the castle in the
background vomit
I saw a wall
god made me go in space you mouth I
didn't make him go you took them on
Space Mountain what's wrong with you
did you black out again you can barely
handle the teacups
you didn't think space that would freak
him out thanks thanks so much and so in
order to fill him here we had to chart
the Sun and figure out what what time
would be best to shoot it so the castle
wouldn't be blown out
unfortunately there's also a waterfall
behind Jim right back there which didn't
make it very easy for sound but I think
we managed to pull it off it's also a
nice place to shoot because there's not
a lot there aren't a lot of people
walking around so we didn't have to deal
with crowds or people walking through
the shots we spent about four hours
doing this scene I think it's some of
the best acting in the movie I'll see
you back at the hotel you're not hungry
